text: Hruzke (Ukrainian: Грузьке) is a village in Makariv District in the Kyiv Region of north Ukraine. == History == Hruzke History by Yevhen Buket The village was established in 1604. Here was born Haydamak leader Ivan Bondarenko. == Geography == The village lies at an altitude of 170 metres and covers an area of 0,483 km². It has a population of about 862 people (2013). == Gallery == File:Ivan Bondarenko haidamaka.jpg|Haydamak leader Ivan Bondarenko File:Gruzke2.jpg|Pond on the river Syvka File:Gruzke7.jpg|In the center of the village File:Wikiexpedition-Gruzke-Chirch.jpg|Orthodox Church File:Gruzke8.jpg|Village Council File:Wikiexpedition-Gruzke- Golodomor-02.jpg|Monument to Holodomor victims == External links == * Video about Hruzke * Information about Hruzke on the site of Makariv Regional State Administration * The history of the village in the project "Cities and villages of Ukraine" * Букет Є. title: Hruzke (Kyiv Region)
